III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was placed at the facility from 11/21/23 until 1/11/24. Staff
communicated inappropriately with youth expressing that youth
was not cared for.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed on February 1, 2024.
Complainant reported an additional concern of lack of medical
treatment after Youth A had reported seizures while at school.
Complainant reported Youth A disclosed having three seizures and
blacked out six times in the school bathroom, and when Youth A
called the facility to come home staff did not come to pick her up,
did not seek medical treatment for her, and did not document it.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at Osceola Youth
Center, on February 1, 2024. Youth A reported she was placed at
New Hope Youth Center from November 11, 2023, until January
11, 2024. Youth A said Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4 would
threaten to “beat her ass”, tell her she was not important, and
make statements about everything that occurred to her in her past
being “her own fault”. Youth A said the staff would never make
these statements around other staff and she said she never told
anyone about the threats or inappropriate statements until being
moved. Youth A said she was provided weekly therapy with
Therapist 1 and Therapist 2 however denied ever telling either of
them about the concerns with the staff members.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
February 26, 2024. Youth B said she has no knowledge of any
staff threatening Youth A. Youth B said none of the staff threaten
or mistreat her.
2

Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
February 26, 2024. Youth C said she has no knowledge of Staff 1,
Staff 2, Staff 3, or Staff 4 threatening Youth A. Youth C said she
had no concerns about the way in which Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3,
Staff 4, or any other staff have treated her at New Hope Youth
Center.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
February 26, 2024. Youth D said she has no knowledge of any
staff threatening or mistreating Youth A. Youth D said Staff 1 and
Staff 4 were always rude in the way they communicated with her,
but noted that they did not threaten or mistreat her. Youth D said
Staff 2 and Staff 3 were “good staff”.
Youth E was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
February 1, 2024. Youth E said Staff 3 and Staff 4 were
“disrespectful” and would swear at the youth and use demeaning
tones. Youth E said she never heard any staff threaten Youth A.
Youth E said, “all staff” do not care about the youth, then stated
except Staff 1 is “a great staff”. Youth E said she has never told
Director any of her concerns.
Therapist 1 was interviewed face-to-face at Osceola Youth
Center on February 1, 2024. Therapist 1 said she was providing
therapy to Youth A until mid-December. Therapist 1 said she met
with Youth A weekly and at no time did Youth A report that staff
were threatening her, stating they did not care about her, or telling
her that her past was her fault.
Therapist 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
February 1, 2024. Therapist 2 said she had provided Youth A
therapy from the second week in December until her discharge in
January. Therapist 2 said Youth A participated in weekly group and
individual sessions. Therapist 2 said Youth A never reported any
concerns about the way in which staff communicated with her or
interacted with her. Therapist 2 said Youth A never told her that
staff were threatening her in any way.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
2, 2024. Staff 1 said she has no knowledge of any staff members
threatening Youth A or telling her that they do not care, or her past
is her fault. Staff 1 denied ever threatening Youth A or telling her
that her past is her fault. Staff 1 said Youth A referred to her as a
“mom” because she was fair and would hold all of them
accountable to their actions.
3

Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
26, 2024. Staff 2 said she has no knowledge of staff threatening
Youth A. Staff 2 said Youth A would bring up her past and make
jokes about it and laugh and she would have to redirect her for
those comments but denied any staff member bringing up Youth
A’s past to her. Staff 2 denied ever threatening Youth A or telling
her she did not care about her.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on February 7, 2024.
Staff 3 said she had worked at New Hope Youth Center when
Youth A was placed there. Staff 3 said she has no knowledge of
staff threatening Youth A. Staff 3 said she has no knowledge of
staff telling Youth A that they did not care or that everything in her
past was her fault. Staff 3 denied ever threatening Youth A or
telling her she did not care about her.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on February 21, 2024.
Staff 4 said she has no knowledge of any staff members
threatening Youth A. Staff 4 denied having any knowledge of any
staff telling Youth A they did not care or that things of her past
where her fault. Staff 4 denied ever threatening or telling Youth A
she did not care about her.
Director was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
February 1, 2024. Director said Youth A never disclosed being
mistreated or threatened by any staff member, nor did she witness
it ever occur.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1 had a disciplinary action on
12/14/2023 for arguing with another staff in front of the
youth. Staff 1 completed Standard of Conduct training on
12/15/2023.
• Staff 2’s personnel file: Staff 2 had a disciplinary action on
9/18/2023 for lack of supervision of youth due to being on
her cell phone. Staff 2 completed Standard of Conduct
training on 3/21/2023.
• Staff 3’s personnel file: Staff 3 had disciplinary actions on
6/9/2023 for sleeping on shift and not doing bed checks,
and on 1/22/2024 for texting her resignation and not
providing two-week notice. Staff 3 completed Standard of
Conduct on 5/3/2023.
• Staff 4’s personnel file: Staff 4 had disciplinary actions on
5/7/2023 for attendance issues, 9/6/2023 for attendance
issues, 9/18/2023 for falsifying bed checks, suspension
from 11/27/2023-12/02/2023 for failure to comply with her
4

performance improvement plan regarding attendance, and
1/18/2024 for sleeping on shift and falsifying bed checks.
Staff 4 completed Standard of Conduct training on
5/31/2023.
• Youth Opportunity’s Standard of Conduct policy was
reviewed and outlines the expectations for staff conduct
with the youth. The policy prohibits staff threatening
violence, and having behavior that is unprofessional,
unethical or abuse.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with Intervention standards and
prohibitions, there is no evidence that Youth A was being
threatened or told she was not cared for by staff members.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section (1) The licensee shall develop and adhere to a written staff-to-
Description resident ratio formula for direct care workers.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was placed at the facility from 11/21/23 until 1/11/24. During
that time, youth was threatened by other youth and staff did not
protect youth. Staff did not document these incidents. Youth was
suicidal and self-harming during this placement.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed on February 1, 2024.
Complainant reported an additional concern of lack of medical
treatment after Youth A had reported seizures while at school.
Complainant reported Youth A disclosed having three seizures and
blacked out six times in the school bathroom, and when Youth A
called the facility to come home staff did not come to pick her up,
did not seek medical treatment for her, and did not document it.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at Osceola Youth
Center, on February 1, 2024. Youth A reported she was placed at
New Hope Youth Center from November 11, 2023, until January
11, 2024. Youth A said while placed at New Hope Youth Center
Youth B would threaten to beath her up “over little things like
getting a drink of water” and at times would “get close” to her
however never touched her. Youth A said she told different staff
members about Youth B’s threatening behaviors, and they would
respond that they did not see it occur so they could not redirect
her in the moment however Youth A stated they gave Youth B
5

“zeros” on her point sheet for the behavior. Youth A denied any
other youth threatening her. Youth A said “all the staff” would
openly talk about drinking after work and “partying”, both in front of
the youth to one another and in direct conversations with the
youth. Youth A said staff never talked to directly to her but rather to
other youth, however, was not able to recall which youth they had
these conversations with. Youth A said she was provided weekly
therapy with Therapist 1 and Therapist 2 however denied ever
telling either of them about the concerns with Youth B. Youth A
said she attended Mount Pleasant High School when placed at
New Hope Youth Center and had an incident when she passed
out in the bathroom and called the facility to return to New Hope
and Staff 4 told her she had to stay at school. Youth A said Staff 1
came to the high school and took her vitals and told her she was
“fine” and that she needed to remain at school. Youth A said once
Staff 1 left the school she went into the bathroom and had three
seizures, passed out multiple times, and no one checked on her
for many hours. Youth A said she reported this to staff as soon as
she got home from school that day and staff “did nothing with the
information”. Youth A said she felt none of the staff would work
with her on her treatment.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
February 26, 2024. Youth B reported she remembers Youth A
being at the facility but does not remember anything else about
her. Youth B denied threatening Youth A stating she has no
memory of talking to her much at all. Youth B had no knowledge of
Youth A’ have seizures.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
February 26, 2024. Youth C said was placed at New Hope Youth
Center when Youth A was there. Youth C said Youth B has
“drama” with most of the youth in the house but does not recall her
ever threatening Youth A. Youth C said she has no knowledge of
Youth A being diagnosed with seizures.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
February 26, 2024. Youth D said she remembered Youth A. Youth
D said she has no knowledge of any youth threatening Youth A.
Youth D said she has no knowledge of Youth A having seizures.
Youth E was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
February 1, 2024. Youth E said she has been placed at New
Hope Youth Center since May 2023. Youth E said Youth B would
“bully” Youth A and the staff did not intervene or redirect Youth B’s
6

behaviors. Youth E said she never saw Youth A having seizures or
talk about having seizures.
Therapist 1 was interviewed face-to-face at Osceola Youth
Center on February 1, 2024. Therapist 1 said Youth A never
talked about any specific youth at the program however noted
Youth A was very overwhelmed being at New Hope Youth Center
due to the amount of stimulation in the environment creating a
“sensory overload” for her. Therapist 1 said she has no information
about Youth A having seizures while at New Hope Youth Center.
Therapist 1 said she has no knowledge of staff discussing their
personal lives with the youth or in front of the youth.
Therapist 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
February 1, 2024. Therapist 2 said she had provided Youth A
therapy from the second week in December until her discharge in
January. Therapist 2 said Youth A participated in weekly group and
individual sessions. Therapist 2 said Youth A never reported any
concerns to her regarding Youth B. Therapist 2 said Youth A had a
very strict safety plan both while at the facility and at school due to
her significant self-harm. Therapist 2 said Youth A had an incident
at the school where she cut herself and needed 56 stiches and
after that event a safety plan was put in place and the school was
very diligent about following it. Therapist 2 said Youth A’s safety
plan consisted of being monitored on the school cameras when
moving from class to class, the school contacting the facility
anytime Youth A was not seen on camera and staff would go to
school to find her, and she had an escort to take her to use the
bathroom. Therapist 2 said Youth A never reported a time when
she has seizures at school. Therapist 2 said she would have a
hard time believing Youth A was in the bathroom for hours due to
the school being so careful with the safety plan and worried about
Youth A’s self-harming behaviors. Therapist 2 said Youth A told her
during a therapy session that she would blackout and that is when
she would cut herself, however there was no evidence to support
this disclosure. Therapist 2 said she has no knowledge of staff
talking about their personal lives to or in front of the youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
2, 2024. Staff 1 said she is the medical staff and has been
employed at New Hope Youth Center since November 2023. Staff
1 said Youth A never told her that Youth B was bullying or
threatening her. Staff 1 denied ever seeing anything outside of
some “everyday drama” with Youth A and Youth B. Staff 1 said she
has not talked about her personal life to other staff and has not
heard staff talking about the things they do outside of work to
7

youth or in front of youth. Staff 1 said Youth A struggled to go to
school and stay in school when she did attend. Staff 1 said Youth
A called one day and said she was not feeling well and wanted to
come back to the facility and Staff 4 had told her she needed to
remain at school. Staff 1 said she then went up to the school and
met with Youth A in a counselor’s office and took her vitals which
were all completely normal and told her she needed to go back to
class. Staff 1 said Youth A left the counselors office with the school
counselor who said was going to walk to her back to class. Staff 1
said she did not hear of any other concerns from that day. Staff 1
said Youth A never disclosed having seizures to her and Youth A
had no history in her file of seizures nor was under any medical
care for seizures.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
26, 2024. Staff 2 said she has no knowledge of Youth A having
seizures. Staff 2 said Youth B threatens all the youth and did not
target Youth A more than any other youth. Staff 2 said whenever
Youth B will threaten or bully the other youth staff will redirect her
and tell her to stop. Staff 2 said she only heard Youth B threaten
Youth A one time, Staff 2 said they were in the van going on an
outing listening to Christmas music and Youth A said she was an
atheist and did not want to hear the music, so Staff 2 shut it off,
this made Youth B upset and she threatened to beat Youth A up.
Staff 2 said she redirected Youth B at that time.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on February 7, 2024.
Staff 3 said she had worked at New Hope Youth Center when
Youth A was placed there. Staff 3 said Youth A disclosed that
Youth B would threaten her however Staff 3 never heard any
threats firsthand. Staff 3 said if she would have heard something
the procedure would be to redirect the youth and then keep a
close eye on the interactions between the youth. Staff 3 denied
ever threatening Youth A or telling her she did not care about her.
Staff 3 said Youth A told her that she had seizures however in all
documentation it was not noted. Staff 3 said she never witnessed
Youth A having any seizures. Staff 3 said she has no knowledge of
staff talking to youth about their personal lives directly to the
youth, however, would talk to one another about events that
happened outside of work or what they were going to do that night
after the youth were in bed.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on February 21, 2024.
Staff 4 said she worked at New Hope Youth Center when Youth A
was placed there. Staff 4 said she is not aware of any specific
incidents of Youth B threatening Youth A however noted that Youth
8

B tends to threaten and bully all of the youth and so if may have
occurred. Staff 4 said all staff would monitor Youth B closely due
to her bullying behaviors. Staff 4 denied Youth A ever disclosing
concerns about Youth B to her. Staff 4 said Youth A would attempt
to come home from school almost daily. Staff 4 said she received
a call from Youth A that she was not feeling well and so Staff 1
went to the school to do a medical evaluation on her. Staff 4 said
Staff 1 determined Youth A could remain at school and at the end
of the school day she went to pick Youth A up. Staff 4 said Youth A
never disclosed being in the bathroom for a long period of time,
passing out, or having seizures. Staff 4 said Youth A did not have
any seizure history in her file and was not being treated for
seizures while placed at New Hope Youth Center.
Director was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
February 1, 2024. Director said Youth A did not have a diagnosis
for seizures and never had seizures to her knowledge. Director
said the school had a safety plan in place that they followed
closely due to Youth A’s self-harm which included them watching
her on camera go from class to class and if they were unable to
locate her on camera, they called New Hope Youth Center, and a
staff would go to the school and search until Youth A was found.
Director said she never had the school report a period when Youth
A was unaccounted for hours of time.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth A’s case file was reviewed. There was no
documentation that Youth A had seizures. There was
documentation that spoke to the care and safety for Youth A
due to her self-harm.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with Sufficiency of Staff, there is
no evidence that the staff allowed Youth B to threaten Youth A.
There is no evidence that the staff did not react and care for all of
Youth A medical and mental health needs.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
